intro: Amsinckia microcalyx, commonly known as the narrowleaf ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Its small, yellow flowers appear in dense clusters, and it produces small, bead-like seeds. Amsinckia microcalyx is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils.
